alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Mississippi; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:04PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central St. Francis, southwestern Mississippi, Crittenden, northwestern DeSoto, western Tipton, southwestern Lauderdale and central Shelby Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 704 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Joiner to Sunset to near New Home. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bartlett, West Memphis, Marion, Millington, Hughes, Wilson, T O Fuller State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Memphis, Munford, Joiner, Edmondson, Horseshoe Lake, Sunset, Gilmore, Bassett, Anthonyville, Jericho, Lake Cormorant and Southwest Memphis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
